attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Under the Sex Discrimination Act 1975 it is unlawful to provide services exclusively for one sex. Therefore, as there is a Minister for Women there must also also be a Minister for Men. 
Men have been discriminated against in many areas for years. Just one example: in all the furore over some women not being able to get their pensions at age 60 as they had not made enough National Insurance contributions, no -one asked why women had been getting a state pension 5 years earlier than men anyway.
A Minister for Men, one would hope, would have challenged this institutional sexism.
Family law, parental leave, healthcare are other areas of discrimination.
Please support this petition.
